request_pathways.name: Autorización para la Divulgación de Información (Spanish)
Mail to Shannon Health HIM/Release of Information
In-person delivery to Shannon Health HIM office

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a generic Authorization for Release of Information PDF, check 'Self' as recipient and 'Personal Use' as purpose, print and hand-fill, then email the completed form to ROIRequests@shannonhealth.org.

red_flags: Blanket fee acceptance: patient must agree to pay unknown fees before learning the cost — form says 'there may be a fee charged' and 'I agree to pay accordingly' without disclosing amounts or referencing HIPAA cost-based limits
bright_spots: Bilingual forms (English and Spanish) linked side-by-side on the medical records page
Email listed as 'Preferred Method' for form submission — unusually patient-friendly
Encrypted email delivery via ShareFile and MyChart portal access as record delivery options
Explicit non-conditioning statement: Shannon cannot condition treatment, payment, enrollment, or benefits on signing the authorization
Three-option substance use disorder records handling (include all, exclude all, select specific) per 42 CFR Part 2

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — 2 clicks from homepage via Patients & Visitors → Request Medical Records, with clearly labeled download links; minor friction from outdated search-engine-cached URLs returning 404.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds — the form is a digitally-authored PDF with a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring patients to print, hand-fill, scan, and email; email submission (preferred method) provides an electronic endpoint but the completion workflow is paper-based.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — logical flow across 2 pages, clear section headers, granular record type selection (~15 checkboxes), good SUD handling, and proportionate length; minor issues include dense legal language on page 2 and ambiguous handling of recipient fields when 'Self' is selected.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the form includes 'Self' and 'Personal Use' options but is fundamentally a generic third-party release authorization; patients must navigate irrelevant recipient fields, and no dedicated patient access pathway or HIPAA Right of Access citation exists.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing that would materially impede a patient — includes non-conditioning statement (uncommon positive), no notarization or witness required, email submission available; the one ambiguity is vague fee disclosure without amounts or reference to HIPAA cost-based limits.

overall.summary: Shannon Health provides an accessible, bilingual records request process with email submission as the preferred method and multiple electronic delivery options, but relies on a generic third-party authorization form without fillable fields rather than offering a dedicated patient access pathway.
